Notes: "Should the final 'a' remain an 'o'? You don't really say 'on' at the end..."

column4: but Americans do. I wonder if the 'r' should remain? But I think pronounced 'r' would simply be considered a feature of American accented ö."

Notes: "I wonder if the 'w' should be removed? I'm still not convinced about this digraph for 'o'."

column4: and none of them as 'e'. We'll take an opportunity to simplify this super-common word to a single letter
column5: and speakers will naturally finish the word as they please."
